meanings.definition: A candle made by dipping a rush in grease or tallow.
meanings.sent1: In the olden days, people would use a rushlight to light up their homes.
meanings.sent2: The rushlight flickered gently in the dark room, casting a warm glow.
meanings.sent3: When the power went out, Sarah grabbed a rushlight and pretended she was in a movie.
meanings.sent4: The rushlight stood tall like a beacon of hope in the dimly lit room.
meanings.sent5: The children were fascinated by the simplicity of the rushlight, watching it burn slowly.

meanings.definition: A rush stem used as a candle.
meanings.sent1: Grandma showed us how to make a rushlight by dipping a rush in melted wax.
meanings.sent2: The rushlight sputtered as it burned, filling the room with a faint scent.
meanings.sent3: Tommy thought it was funny to pretend the rushlight was a tiny tree in a forest of darkness.
meanings.sent4: The rushlight glowed like a miniature torch in the palm of her hand.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of the rushlight's design made it a charming addition to the rustic decor.
